titleStmt.title: The two jeering lovers, or, A pleasant new dialogue between Dick Down-right of the country, and pretty witty Nancy of the citie the manner of their wooing, winning, and wedding shall be related in this ensuing ditty : to a dainty new tune, called, Now the tyrant hath stolen, &c.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

titleStmt.title: The two jeering lovers, or, A pleasant new dialogue between Dick Down-right of the country, and pretty witty Nancy of the citie the manner of their wooing, winning, and wedding shall be related in this ensuing ditty : to a dainty new tune, called, Now the tyrant hath stolen, &c.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Gilbertson in Gilt-spur Street,
